title: Print Function Deep Dive
content:
## The print() Function

The `print()` function is your primary tool for displaying output in Python.

```python
print("Hello, World!")
```

## Function Signature

```python
print(*objects, sep=' ', end='\n', file=sys.stdout, flush=False)
```

Let's explore each parameter.

## Printing Multiple Values

print() can take multiple arguments:

```python
name = "Alice"
age = 25
city = "NYC"

# Multiple values separated by space (default)
print(name, age, city)
# Output: Alice 25 NYC

# Any number of arguments
print(1, 2, 3, 4, 5)
# Output: 1 2 3 4 5

# Mix of types
print("Value:", 42, "| Status:", True)
# Output: Value: 42 | Status: True
```

## The sep Parameter

Change the separator between values:

```python
# Default separator (space)
print("A", "B", "C")
# Output: A B C

# Custom separator
print("A", "B", "C", sep="-")
# Output: A-B-C

print("A", "B", "C", sep=" | ")
# Output: A | B | C

print("A", "B", "C", sep="")
# Output: ABC

print(2023, 12, 25, sep="/")
# Output: 2023/12/25

# Create a file path
print("home", "user", "documents", sep="/")
# Output: home/user/documents
```

## The end Parameter

Change what happens at the end of print:

```python
# Default behavior - adds newline
print("Line 1")
print("Line 2")
# Output:
# Line 1
# Line 2

# Custom end
print("Hello", end=" ")
print("World")
# Output: Hello World

# No newline
print("Loading", end="")
print("...", end="")
print("Done!")
# Output: Loading...Done!

# Custom ending
print("Item 1", end=" | ")
print("Item 2", end=" | ")
print("Item 3")
# Output: Item 1 | Item 2 | Item 3
```

## String Formatting Methods

### Method 1: f-strings (Recommended)

```python
name = "Alice"
age = 25
score = 95.5

# f-strings (Python 3.6+)
print(f"Name: {name}")
print(f"Age: {age}")
print(f"{name} is {age} years old")

# Expressions inside f-strings
print(f"Next year age: {age + 1}")
print(f"Score: {score:.2f}")  # Format to 2 decimal places
```

### Method 2: format()

```python
print("Name: {} Age: {}".format(name, age))
print("Name: {0} Age: {1}".format(name, age))
```

# Print Function Deep Dive - Examples

# Basic printing
print("Hello, World!")
print()  # Empty line

# Multiple values
name = "Alice"
age = 25
print("Name:", name, "Age:", age)

# Using sep parameter
print("\nCustom separators:")
print("apple", "banana", "cherry", sep=" | ")
print(2024, 1, 15, sep="-")
print("www", "example", "com", sep=".")

# Using end parameter
print("\nCustom endings:")
print("Loading", end="")
print(".", end="")
print(".", end="")
print(". Done!")

# f-strings (recommended)
print("\nf-string examples:")
product = "Widget"
price = 29.99
quantity = 3
print(f"Product: {product}")
print(f"Price: ${price:.2f}")
print(f"Quantity: {quantity}")
print(f"Total: ${price * quantity:.2f}")

# Formatting numbers
print("\nNumber formatting:")
big_number = 1234567890
pi = 3.14159265359
print(f"Large number: {big_number:,}")
print(f"Pi (2 decimals): {pi:.2f}")
print(f"Pi (4 decimals): {pi:.4f}")
print(f"Percentage: {0.856:.1%}")

# Alignment
print("\nAlignment:")
print(f"|{'left':<10}|{'center':^10}|{'right':>10}|")
